claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: A table listing trade names and manufacturers of influenza vaccines, their presentations, age indications, hemagglutinin antigen content per virus (µg HA per dose), route of administration, and mercury content. Flublok Quadrivalent (recombinant HA vaccine) is shown with 45 µg/0.5 mL, while standard-dose egg-based quadrivalents are listed with 15 µg/0.5 mL per virus. Evidence: Flublok Quadrivalent is specified as containing 45 µg HA per strain versus 15 µg HA per strain in standard-dose egg-based quadrivalent vaccines. The table demonstrates that Flublok contains 3× the hemagglutinin antigen content of standard-dose vaccines but does not provide any information on immunogenicity or link increased antigen content to greater immunogenicity, so it does not support the claim in full. Note: Table only shows antigen content; no immunogenicity data are included.
